lead_paragraph: The government has agreed to make public the audio recordings of the proceedings of the Joint Drafting Committee constituted to frame the Lokpal Bill, in response to a query filed by an activist under the Right to Information Act, The Hindu reports.The anti-corruption activist Anna Hazare is "above Parliament and had the right to threaten to go on fast to get bills passed," his adviser Arvind Kejriwal said Sunday, marking a radical change from the civil society group's position so far, The Times of India reports. Kejriwal justified his decision to campaign against the Congress Party in the an upcoming state election, "saying it was the ruling party's duty to ensure passage of the Jan Lokpal Bill", the paper reports.

headline.main: Newswallah: In the English-Language Press Monday
